intro: Randia silae, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, fragrant flowers and red, fleshy berries. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Randia silae is also known for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other regions, sometimes becoming invasive.
